p: Portugal had one of the highest rates of HIV diagnoses in Europe in 2016, with 10.0 diagnoses per 100,000 population [ 1]. Despite the fact that new diagnoses have decreased within the country in the last years [ 2], the patterns of HIV-1 transmission remain uncertain. Phylogenetic analyses are powerful tools to understand the dynamics of viral transmission [ 3â€“ 7] and to provide insights for designing prevention policies.
